access_token.description: Redpanda client token. You need either `access_token`, or both `client_id` and `client_secret` to use this provider. Can also be set with the `REDPANDA_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable.

azure_client_id.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Can also be specified in the environment as AZURE_CLIENT_ID or ARM_CLIENT_ID

azure_client_secret.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Can also be specified in the environment as AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET or ARM_CLIENT_SECRET

azure_subscription_id.description: The default Azure Subscription ID which should be used for Redpanda BYOC clusters. If another subscription is specified on a resource, it will take precedence. This can also be sourced from the `ARM_SUBSCRIPTION_ID` environment variable.

azure_tenant_id.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Can also be specified in the environment as AZURE_TENANT_ID or ARM_TENANT_ID

client_id.description: The ID for the client. You need either `client_id` AND `client_secret`, or `access_token`, to use this provider. Can also be set with the `REDPANDA_CLIENT_ID` environment variable.

client_secret.description: Redpanda client secret. You need either `client_id` AND `client_secret`, or `access_token`, to use this provider. Can also be set with the `REDPANDA_CLIENT_SECRET` environment variable.

gcp_project_id.description: The default Google Cloud Project ID to use for Redpanda BYOC clusters. If another project is specified on a resource, it will take precedence. This can also be sourced from the `GOOGLE_PROJECT` environment variable, or any of the following ordered by precedence: `GOOGLE_PROJECT`, `GOOGLE_CLOUD_PROJECT`, `GCLOUD_PROJECT`, or `CLOUDSDK_CORE_PROJECT`.

google_credentials.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Can also be specified in the environment as GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS

google_credentials_base64.description: Used for creating and managing BYOC and BYOVPC clusters. Is a convenience passthrough for base64 encoded credentials intended for use in CI/CD. Can also be specified in the environment as GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS_BASE64

cluster_api_url.description: The cluster API URL. Changing this will prevent deletion of the resource on the existing cluster. It is generally a better idea to delete an existing resource and create a new one than to change this value unless you are planning to do state imports

host.description: The host address to use for this ACL

operation.description: The operation type that shall be allowed or denied (e.g READ)

permission_type.description: The permission type. It determines whether the operation should be ALLOWED or DENIED

principal.description: The principal to apply this ACL for

resource_name.description: The name of the resource this ACL entry will be on

resource_pattern_type.description: The pattern type of the resource. It determines the strategy how the provided resource name is matched (LITERAL, MATCH, PREFIXED, etc ...) against the actual resource names

resource_type.description: The type of the resource (TOPIC, GROUP, etc...) this ACL shall target

allow_deletion.description: Allows deletion of the cluster. Defaults to true. Should probably be set to false for production use.

allowed_principals.description: The ARN of the principals that can access the Redpanda AWS PrivateLink Endpoint Service. To grant permissions to all principals, use an asterisk (*).

connect_console.description: Whether Console is connected via PrivateLink.

created_at.description: When the PrivateLink service was created.

deleted_at.description: When the PrivateLink service was deleted.

kafka_api_node_base_port.description: Base port for Kafka API nodes.

kafka_api_seed_port.description: Port for Kafka API seed brokers.

redpanda_proxy_node_base_port.description: Base port for HTTP proxy nodes.

service_state.description: Current state of the PrivateLink service.

created_at.description: When the endpoint connection was created.

status.description: Current status of the PrivateLink configuration.

allowed_subscriptions.description: The subscriptions that can access the Redpanda Azure PrivateLink Endpoint Service. To grant permissions to all principals, use an asterisk (*).

connect_console.description: Whether Console is connected in Redpanda Azure Private Link Service.

enabled.description: Whether Redpanda Azure Private Link Endpoint Service is enabled.

approved_subscriptions.description: List of approved Azure subscription IDs.

created_at.description: When the Private Link service was created.

deleted_at.description: When the Private Link service was deleted.

dns_a_record.description: DNS A record for the service.

kafka_api_node_base_port.description: Base port for Kafka API nodes.

kafka_api_seed_port.description: Port for Kafka API seed brokers.

created_at.description: When the endpoint connection was created.

redpanda_proxy_node_base_port.description: Base port for HTTP proxy nodes.

status.description: Current status of the Private Link configuration.

cloud_provider.description: Cloud provider where resources are created.

cluster_api_url.description: The URL of the cluster API.

cluster_type.description: Cluster type. Type is immutable and can only be set on cluster creation.

connection_type.description: Cluster connection type. Private clusters are not exposed to the internet. For BYOC clusters, Private is best-practice.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the cluster was created.

arn.description: ARN for the agent instance profile
ARN for the cloud storage bucket
ARN for the cluster security group
ARN for the connectors node group instance profile
ARN for the connectors security group
ARN for the Kubernetes cluster role
ARN for the node security group
ARN for the permissions boundary policy
ARN for the redpanda agent security group
ARN for the redpanda node group instance profile
ARN for the redpanda node group security group
ARN for the utility node group instance profile
ARN for the utility security group

agent_service_account.description: GCP service account for the agent.

connector_service_account.description: GCP service account for managed connectors.

console_service_account.description: GCP service account for Redpanda Console.

gke_service_account.description: GCP service account for GCP Kubernetes Engine (GKE).

psc_nat_subnet_name.description: NAT subnet name if GCP Private Service Connect is enabled.

redpanda_cluster_service_account.description: GCP service account for the Redpanda cluster.

name.description: Secondary IPv4 range name for pods.
Secondary IPv4 range name for services.

subnet.description: GCP subnet where Redpanda cluster is deployed.

tiered_storage_bucket.description: GCP storage bucket for Tiered storage.

customer_managed_resources.description: Customer managed resources configuration for the cluster.

gcp_global_access_enabled.description: If true, GCP global access is enabled.

source.description: Either the GCP project number or its alphanumeric ID.

consumer_accept_list.description: List of consumers that are allowed to connect to Redpanda GCP PSC (Private Service Connect) service attachment.

enabled.description: Whether Redpanda GCP Private Service Connect is enabled.

created_at.description: When the Private Service Connect service was created.

deleted_at.description: When the Private Service Connect service was deleted.

dns_a_records.description: DNS A records for the service.

kafka_api_node_base_port.description: Base port for Kafka API nodes.

kafka_api_seed_port.description: Port for Kafka API seed brokers.

redpanda_proxy_node_base_port.description: Base port for HTTP proxy nodes.

status.description: Current status of the Private Service Connect configuration.

principal_mapping_rules.description: Principal mapping rules for mTLS authentication. See the Redpanda documentation on configuring authentication.

id.description: ID of the cluster. ID is an output from the Create Cluster endpoint and cannot be set by the caller.

principal_mapping_rules.description: Principal mapping rules for mTLS authentication. See the Redpanda documentation on configuring authentication.

anytime.description: If true, maintenance can occur at any time.

unspecified.description: If true, maintenance window is unspecified.

maintenance_window_config.description: Maintenance window configuration for the cluster.

network_id.description: Network ID where cluster is placed.

read_replica_cluster_ids.description: IDs of clusters that can create read-only topics from this cluster.

redpanda_version.description: Current Redpanda version of the cluster.

region.description: Cloud provider region. Region represents the name of the region where the cluster will be provisioned.

resource_group_id.description: Resource group ID of the cluster.

principal_mapping_rules.description: Principal mapping rules for mTLS authentication. See the Redpanda documentation on configuring authentication.

code.description: Error code if cluster is in error state.

message.description: Detailed error message if cluster is in error state.

state_description.description: Detailed state description when cluster is in a non-ready state.

tags.description: Tags placed on cloud resources. If the cloud provider is GCP and the name of a tag has the prefix "gcp.network-tag.", the tag is a network tag that will be added to the Redpanda cluster GKE nodes. Otherwise, the tag is a normal tag. For example, if the name of a tag is "gcp.network-tag.network-tag-foo", the network tag named "network-tag-foo" will be added to the Redpanda cluster GKE nodes. Note: The value of a network tag will be ignored. See the details on network tags at https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/add-remove-network-tags.

zones.description: Zones of the cluster. Must be valid zones within the selected region. If multiple zones are used, the cluster is a multi-AZ cluster.

cidr_block.description: The cidr_block to create the network in

cloud_provider.description: The cloud provider to create the network in.

cluster_type.description: The type of cluster this network is associated with, can be one of dedicated or cloud

arn.description: AWS DynamoDB table identifier
AWS storage bucket identifier
AWS VPC identifier

name.description: GCP storage bucket name for storing the state of Redpanda cluster deployment

network_name.description: Name of user-created network where the Redpanda cluster is deployed

network_project_id.description: GCP project ID where the network is created

region.description: The region to create the network in.

resource_group_id.description: The ID of the resource group in which to create the network

name.description: Name of the resource group. Changing the name of a resource group will result in a new resource group being created and the old one being destroyed

cluster_api_url.description: The URL of the dataplane API for the serverless cluster

id.description: The ID of the serverless cluster

resource_group_id.description: The ID of the Resource Group in which to create the serverless cluster

serverless_region.description: Redpanda specific region of the serverless cluster

allow_deletion.description: Indicates whether the topic can be deleted.

cluster_api_url.description: The cluster API URL. Changing this will prevent deletion of the resource on the existing cluster. It is generally a better idea to delete an existing resource and create a new one than to change this value unless you are planning to do state imports

configuration.description: A map of string key/value pairs of topic configurations.

partition_count.description: The number of partitions for the topic. This determines how the data is distributed across brokers. Increases are fully supported without data loss, decreases will result in an error and should be accomplished by creating a new topic and migrating the data.

replication_factor.description: The replication factor for the topic, which defines how many copies of the data are kept across different brokers for fault tolerance.

block.description: Topic represents a Kafka topic configuration

cluster_api_url.description: The cluster API URL. Changing this will prevent deletion of the resource on the existing cluster. It is generally a better idea to delete an existing resource and create a new one than to change this value unless you are planning to do state imports

mechanism.description: Which authentication method to use, see https://docs.redpanda.com/current/manage/security/authentication/ for more information

name.description: Name of the user, must be unique

block.description: User is a user that can be created in Redpanda
